summary: This document is an email chain between U.S. Attorney's Office personnel discussing the status of FBI 302 interview reports and handwritten notes for the Epstein case. It reveals the scale of the investigation (over 120 interviews) and administrative efforts to reconcile documentation.

events.title: Interview conducted
events.description: An interview was conducted on this date, for which a 302 report exists but handwritten notes may not.

keyFacts: The investigation involved more than 120 interviews, indicating its extensive scope.
There was an administrative effort to reconcile FBI 302 reports with handwritten interview notes, with some interviews having reports but no notes.
The correspondence highlights confusion over labeling and attachments for specific interviews, including one on July 6, 2019.
The communication is between personnel in the U.S. Attorney's Office, showing internal coordination on evidence collection.
